info.question: IAM allows you to manage ______ and their access to the AWS console
IAM gives you which of these
answers: Centralized control of your AWS account
Shared access to your AWS account
correctAnswer: Centralized control of your AWS account
Shared access to your AWS account

info.question: IAM gives you which of these
answers: Enables identity federation (including Active Directory, Facebook, Linkedin, etc.)
Provides temporary access for users/devices and services
Provides temporary access from external services
correctAnswer: Enables identity federation (including Active Directory, Facebook, Linkedin, etc.)
Provides temporary access for users/devices and services

info.question: IAM gives you which of these
answers: Allows you to set up your own password rotation policy
Integrates with many different AWS services
Supports PCI (Payment Card Industry) DSS compliance
correctAnswer: Allows you to set up your own password rotation policy
Integrates with many different AWS services
Supports PCI (Payment Card Industry) DSS compliance

info.question: With IAM, when you think end users or people, with which of these are you working?
With IAM, when you have a collection of users under one set of permissions, with which of these are you working?
With IAM, when you create roles and then assign them to AWS resources, with which of these are you working?
With IAM, when you have a document that defines one (or more) permissions; can be attached to either a user, a group, or a role, with which of these are you working?
